title: “It’s not that bad” they told me - Coreboot
Visualizing a Million Time Series with the Density Line Chart
description:
Abstract:

Data analysts often need to work with multiple series of data—conventionally shown as line charts—at once. Few visual representations allow analysts to view many lines simultaneously without becoming overwhelming or cluttered. In this paper, we introduce the DenseLines technique to calculate a discrete density representation of time series. DenseLines normalizes time series by the arc length to compute accurate densities. The derived density visualization allows users both to see the aggregate trends of multiple series and to identify anomalous extrema.
description_plain:
Abstract:

Data analysts often need to work with multiple series of data—conventionally shown as line charts—at once. Few visual representations allow analysts to view many lines simultaneously without becoming overwhelming or cluttered. In this paper, we introduce the DenseLines technique to calculate a discrete density representation of time series. DenseLines normalizes time series by the arc length to compute accurate densities. The derived density visualization allows users both to see the aggregate trends of multiple series and to identify anomalous extrema.

What are "promotional" websites (not doc sites) that as a developer/SW eng you find useful/descriptive of a technology you use or consider using?
description:
After spending hours wading through sparse documentation when evaluating new tech, I’m wondering what promotional sites you all actually find useful when making tech decisions. Beyond the official docs, what vendor/project sites have genuinely helped you understand a technology/library/component/app’s capabilities and tradeoffs?

I’m looking for examples where marketing sites actually delivered a a clear message - whether through interactive demos, architecture diagrams, practical comparisons, or just clear explanations of real-world use cases. And what specifically made them stand out from the typical buzzword-laden landing pages we usually see?
description_plain:

description: The core conceit was making an OS which self deploys onto new machinesz measuring the hardware etc. and figuring out how to optimize itself - expecting a future with many machine types, where it’d be too costly to actually port OSs to them.

Odin tag
description:
Hi, so I noticed Odin programming language does not have a tag. I don’t know how many fellow Odin programmers we have here, but here’s couple posts that could’ve used the tag:

  • https://lobste.rs/s/3lf0w3/mistakes_cool_things_do_with_arena
  • https://lobste.rs/s/noerku/moving_my_game_project_from_c_odin (hey that’s mine lol)

And if you search for Odin you’ll find more.

I guess most use the tags for filtering things out, but I do browse specific tags every now and then, so I would like to see tag for one of my favorite programming languages, to find stuff about it easier. :)

Cheers!
